byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD

abstract: Roberta S Jacobson, State Dept official who has played key role in restoring diplomatic relations with Cuba, is set to be nominated by Pres Obama as ambassador to Mexico; has support from both parties in Congress, but could face resistance from opponents of changes in Cuba policy.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Jacobson, a Mexico specialist who rose through the ranks of the State Department, has been at the center of Mr. Obama’s overhaul of American policy toward Cuba.

headline.main: Obama Plans to Nominate Roberta Jacobson to Be Ambassador to Mexico
headline.print_headline: Obama Picks State Dept. Official as Envoy to Mexico

snippet: Ms. Jacobson, a Mexico specialist who rose through the ranks of the State Department, has been at the center of Mr. Obama’s overhaul of American policy toward Cuba.
